message.content:
I'll analyze the cash flow statement to identify the net cash flow from operating activities and its component sub-items.

Looking at the statement, I can see the "Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities" line has a value of "-224133.22" as of 2024-01-28.

The 7 component sub-items that make up this number are:
1. Net Profit: 1193771.08
2. Depreciation: 45749.30
3. (Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable: -1562598.26
4. (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable: -10811.11
5. (Increase) Decrease in Inventory: -720000.00
6. Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable: 545000.00
7. Increase (Decrease) in Tax Payable: 284755.77

Let's verify that these sub-items add up to the net cash flow from operating activities:
1193771.08 + 45749.30 + (-1562598.26) + (-10811.11) + (-720000.00) + 545000.00 + 284755.77 = -224133.22

This confirms that these are the correct sub-items that make up the net cash flow from operating activities.
